meanings.definition: The machinery and equipment used in printing and publishing.
meanings.sent1: The pressworks in the printing shop are very noisy.
meanings.sent2: The pressworks are essential for producing newspapers and books.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got stuck in the pressworks and caused a paper jam.
meanings.sent4: The pressworks hummed like a busy bee, churning out pages of text.
meanings.sent5: The pressworks clanked and whirred, creating a symphony of production.

meanings.definition: The process of printing or publishing using a printing press.
meanings.sent1: Learning about pressworks involves understanding how printing machines operate.
meanings.sent2: Pressworks require precision and expertise to produce high-quality prints.
meanings.sent3: The pressworks decided to go on strike, leaving the newspapers without headlines.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a pressworks, constantly churning out new ideas and stories.
meanings.sent5: The pressworks roared to life, bringing the blank pages to vibrant color.

meanings.definition: The physical act of pressing or squeezing something.
meanings.sent1: The pressworks of the juicer extract fresh juice from fruits.
meanings.sent2: His strong hands applied just the right amount of pressure in the pressworks.
meanings.sent3: The pressworks of the hug made her feel warm and loved.
meanings.sent4: Time felt like a heavy pressworks, squeezing every moment tightly.
meanings.sent5: The pressworks of the massage melted away all tension and stress.
